revised_title: Hydrogen Peroxide Formation in Low-Pressure Combustion of Hydrogen
tldr: The authors investigated the formation of hydrogen peroxide in the combustion of hydrogen at low pressures. They found that under certain conditions, more than 30% of the condensate can consist of hydrogen peroxide. The results indicate that hydrogen peroxide is formed by two mechanisms: recombination of hydroxyl radicals on cold walls and the formation of an excited radical that reacts with a hydrogen molecule to create hydrogen peroxide.
